doc.title: Pernod Ricard FY25 - A mixed bag of: weak demand, impressive cost control, improved FCF and dilution from disposals
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Pernod Ricard FY25 - A mixed bag of weak demand impressive cost control improved FCF and dilution from disposalsPernod R_2025-08-29

passages.text: **Pernod Ricard SA**

FY25 was a very mixed bag (see title and below). FY26 is also going to be very mixed,with a very weak Q1, continued cost control (albeit offset by the hit from tariffs), a further improvement in FCF conversion but dilution from disposals. But the critical question is: what takes Pernod to +3% to +6% top-line. Underlying trends in India remain strong and will improve with the disposal of Imperial Blue. The drag from wine will drop out. Share trends in the US are moving in the right direction (albeit not quite +ve yet) and are in +ve territory in many markets. However, a recovery in underlying market growth in the USA and China is critical. In both markets, we believe the worm will ultimately turn. But there is no sign yet. And it will likely be the Festive Season in the USA and the build up to New Year in China before there are definitive indications.

**FY25** top-line growth was in line with expectations, once again with Europe and Asia-RoW outperforming. The positive surprise came from EBIT, FCF and EPS beating expectations,despite higher hit from FX and finance costs. Organic EBIT margin expanded 60bps.

**FY26 was reiterated as a year of transition with "improving trend" in org. top-line growth.**However, whatever recovery there is will be H2 weighted, as Q1 will be hit due to multiple factors - high trade inventories in the US due to stock buildup ahead of tariffs, and in China.Furthermore, the recent increase in Excise taxes in the Indian state of Maharashtra take effect in Q1, leading to an increase in RSP to offset the higher taxes (and likely front-loading in Q4). Finally, the resumption of Cognac sales in China Duty-Free will only feed through into shipments from Q2. We note the disposal of most of the global wine business and of **Imperial Blue in India, both are accretive to growth and margin but dilutive to FY26 EPS.**

We update our model for these results, FX and slightly tweak our estimates in line with guidance.We lower our EPS for FY26E by -2.1% and for FY27E by -3.6% (-ve FX & dilution from disposals). Consequently, we trim our PT to €133, but reiterate out Outperform rating.

Asavari Paluskar, CFA
**Specialist Sales**

Adjusted EPSF24AF25EF26EFinancialsF24AF25EF26ECAGRValuation MetricsF24AF25EF26ERI.FP (EUR)7.907.266.84Revenues (M)11,59810,95910,120(6.6)%Adjusted P/E (x)12.713.814.7OLD--7.216.99EBIT (M)2,7092,8132,7540.8%EV/Sales (x)3.23.43.7Net Debt/EBITDA(x)3.083.293.141.0%Div Yield (%)4.74.34.1
Source: Bloomberg, Bernstein estimates and analysis.

For FY25, Sales organic decline was \(- 3\%\) (vs. consensus and Bernstein at \(- 3.2\%\) ). Americas were slightly worse than expected at \(- 2.9\%\) , dragged by the US. Asia- RoW \((- 3.9\%)\) and Europe \((- 1.8\%)\) were ahead of expectations.

In Q4, Sales were down \(- 0.3\%\) organically, coming in ahead of consensus \((- 0.8\%)\) and our expectations \((- 1.1\%)\) . Organic sales growth beat expectations in Asia- RoW \((+2\%)\) , vs. consensus \(+0.2\%\) , Bernstein \(- 1\%\) and Europe \((+2\%)\) , vs. consensus \(- 1\%\) , Bernstein \(- 1\%\) , but missed in Americas \(- 5\%\) (vs. consensus \(- 4\%\) , Bernstein \(- 2\%\) ) (Exhibit 1 & Exhibit 2).
EXHIBIT 1: Pernod posted a \(- 0.4\%\) organic sales decline in EXHIBIT 2: ... leading to \(- 3\%\) organic sales decline for F25 Q4 F25...
Source: Corporate reports, Bernstein analysis
Source: Corporate reports, Bernstein analysis

Strategic International Brands continue to drag the performance \((- 4\%)\) OSG), due to the decline of Martell in China, weak Jameson in Western Europe and the Scotch portfolio impacted in key regions. Strategic Local Brands were up \(+2\%\) during the year, driven by Seagram's whiskies, while Specialty Brands were down \(- 7\%\) , and RTDs grew \(7\%\) . (Exhibit 4).
EXHIBIT 3: Performance of the Top brands is weak...
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis
EXHIBIT 4: ... but Absolut grew
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis

Recurring Operating Profit declined \(- 0.8\%\) organically, beating expectations (vs consensus \(- 3.1\%\) , Bernstein \(- 2.5\%\) ), driven by the efficiency program and cost discipline. Net profit and EPS were also a beat on expectations, despite slightly higher
finance costs (Exhibit 5).
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis and estimates
Over FY25, Pernod Ricard benefited from a strategic reduction in A&P spending and cost- cutting efforts (Exhibit 6). Overall, organic OP margins increased \(+60\) bps in FY25 (Exhibit 7).
EXHIBIT 6: There was some operating leverage thanks to gross margin expansion and lower A&P
Pernod Ricard Group Organic Growth (F25)
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis
EXHIBIT 7: Organic operating profit margin expanded 60bps in F25
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis

The group reiterated the mid- term guidance for \(+3\%\) to \(+6\%\) organic sales growth(F27- F29). However, FY26 is guided to be a year of transition with "improving trend" in org. top- line growth, concentrated in H2. Q1 will likely be impacted by elevated inventories in the US and China, excise tax changes in Maharashtra (India), China D/F likely to open only in Q2, and weak FX. Cost controls and efficiencies are likely the key focus areas, with strategic investments guided to be \(
tpline growth and margin expansion partly offset by negative scope and FX (Exhibit 8, Exhibit 9).
EXHIBIT 8: We expect FY26E EPS to decline \(-6\%\) ...
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis and estimates
EXHIBIT 9: ... but an EPS CAGR of c. 5% over the next four years
Source: Company reports, Bernstein estimates & analysis
Pernod Ricard is overweight to Asia- RoW, compared to the Americas and Europe (Exhibit 10).
EXHIBIT 10: Pernod Ricard is overweight to Asia- RoW, compared to the Americas and Europe
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis

In Asia- RoW, the largest Spirits markets by value for Pernod Ricard are China and India according to our estimates and IWSR data (Exhibit 11), though we note that IWSR data are based on retail selling price, including excise tax, which overstates the importance of high- tax India. We estimate that both markets account for slightly more than 10% of Pernod Ricard's group sales.
Asia- RoW sales were up \(+1.6\%\) in 4Q25 (FY25: \(- 4\%\) ) organically, as India remained strong, while China continued to be very weak (Exhibit 12).
EXHIBIT 11: In Asia- RoW, China and India are Pernod Ricard's largest Spirits markets by value
Pernod Ricard Asia-RoW Spirits Breakdown (2024)
Source: IWSR, Bernstein analysis
EXHIBIT 12: Pernod Ricard Asia reported \(+1.6\%\) organic revenue growth in Q4 F25
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis

India continued to outperform other regions and drove growth in the region. It posted \(+6\%\) organic topline growth in FY25 (4Q25 \(+11\%\) ), driven by strong consumer demand along with premiumization trends. (Exhibit 13). However, the excise tax changes in
Maharashtra are likely to hit Q1 performance.

China sales declined by \(- 21\%\) in FY25 (4Q at \(- 29\%\) ) (Exhibit 14). The consumer environment remains very soft and despite strong growth in premium brands outside Cognac, \(85\%\) of the business is Martell which was still in decline, with inventory levels elevated due to the anti- dumping investigation, expected to correct in Q1F26.

Japan grew MSD, but Taiwan and Korea were sharply in declined. Turkey continued to perform strongly, driven by Chivas and Ballantine's. Global Travel Retail was down \(- 9\%\) , due to the suspension of Cognac in China Duty Free since Dec 2024 ending in July 2025. The company expect GTR to resume to growth in 2Q26.
EXHIBIT 13: India delivered \(11\%\) organic growth in Q4 F25
Source: Company reports, Bernstein estimates & analysis
EXHIBIT 14: China was down \(-29\%\) in Q4 F25
Source: Company reports, Bernstein estimates & analysis
On an annualized basis, Asia RoW reported profit margins were \(29.3\%\) , up \(+70\) bps sequentially (Exhibit 15) and \(- 10\) bps below FY24 levels.
EXHIBIT 15: Pernod Ricard reported c. 70bps annualized margin expansion in Asia- RoW sequentially
Pernod Ricard Asia-RoW MAT operating margins
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis
Looking at the organic drivers in detail (Exhibit 16& Exhibit 17), margins declined less than the top- line in Asia, driven by lower A&P and SG&A spends. FY25 organic margins expanded \(+90\) bps.
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis
EXHIBIT 19: Americas net sales declined - 5.2% organically EXHIBIT 20: ...and MAT margins contracted by 20bps in Q4 F25...
Pernod Americas Organic Revenue Growth (%YoY)
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis
Pernod Ricard Americas MAT operating margins
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis

Pernod Ricard's brand are seeing a mixed performance in the latest NABCA. All brands except Kahlua, Olmeca Altos, Absolut Cocktails, and Del Maguey are in decline. However, most of Pernod's major brands (Jameson, Malibu, Absolut, and Seagram's Gin) are in decline YoY but accelerating YoY. Beefeater and Malibu Cocktail are both in decline and decelerating YoY [n.b. we cannot include Skrewball in the chart below as we do not have growth rate for last year to show acceleration/ deceleration. The brand declined - 3.2% YoY for 3m to June- 25 in NABCA] (Exhibit 21).
Even excluding RTDs, the rate of decline for Pernod Ricard US is slowing (Exhibit 22), and its volumes growth gap to the market (ex. cocktails) now close to flat (Exhibit 23).
EXHIBIT 21: Pernod Ricard's US Spirits are weak but trending less worse, according to the latest NABCA data
Source: NABCA, Bernstein analysis
Source:NABCA,Bernstein analysis
EXHIBIT 23: ... with the growth gap to the market ex. cocktails now almost flat
Source:NABCA,Bernstein analysis

Looking at the organic drivers in detail in the Americas (Exhibit 24 & Exhibit 25), organic operating profit grew \(+0.3\%\) , due to lower A&P and SG&A expenses. At an organic margin level, we saw \(+90\) bps of margin expansion.
EXHIBIT 24: Declining net sales and higher COGS were more than offset by lower A&P and SG&A expenses
EXHIBIT 25: ... resulting in operating margins expanding +90bps in F25
Pernod Ricard Americas Organic Growth (F25)
Source:Company reports,Bernstein analysis
Americas Organic %pts Change in Margin (F25)
Source:Company reports,Bernstein analysis

In Europe, France, Turkiye, the UK, Poland, Germany and Spain are the largest markets for Pernod Ricard Spirits. Russia used to be a large market and the company has been exiting the country since 2Q23 (Exhibit 26).
Period Ricard Europe Spirits Breakdown (2024)
Source: IWSR, Bernstein analysis
Period Ricard Europe organic sales declined \(- 2\%\) for FY25 (+1.5% in 4Q25), but posted a flat FY25 growth excluding Russia, which now drops out of the comps (Exhibit 27).

Eastern Europe and France were strong, while Germany and Spain declined. (Exhibit 28). Pernod gained market shares in France and Germany and was stable in the UK. Bumbu, Jameson, Chivas, Ballantine's, Perrier- Jouet and Altos posted good brand performances.
EXHIBIT 27: Europe grew \(+1.2\%\) organically in Q4 F25...
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis
EXHIBIT 28: ... while MAT margins were \(+80\) bps up sequentially
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis

Looking at the organic drivers in detail in total Europe (Exhibit 29 and Exhibit 30), organic operating profit declined \(- 1.4\%\) on declining net sales and higher input costs. However, margins expanded \(+10\) bps sequentially on an organic basis in F25.
Pernod Ricard Europe Organic Growth (F25)
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis
Europe Organic %pts Change in Margin (F25)
Source: Company reports, Bernstein analysis
EXHIBIT 31: Pernd Ricard Income Statement

On April 1, 2024, Société Générale (SG) and AllianceBernstein, LP. (AB) completed a transaction that created a new joint venture in which their respective cash equities and research businesses operate in a new business combination. Although their respective ownership percentages in the joint venture differ between North America and the rest of the world, the creation, production and publication of research is handled collaboratively on a global basis across the two research brands, "Bernstein" and "Autonomous". Unless specifically noted otherwise, for purposes of these disclosures, references to Bernstein's "affiliates" relate to both SG and AB and their respective affiliates.
We value Pernod Ricard on a P/E NTM+1 basis, at a target multiple of 17.8x, reaching a PT of €133.
Potential downside risks to our Outperform rating and Price Target:

- Global recession that significantly reduces demand for premium spirits- A slow return to normal growth in China and remaining tariffs on Cognac- Further slowdown in the growth of Jameson, and an inability to have a product to replace this as main growth driver in USA

The Bernstein brand rates stocks based on forecasts of relative performance for the next 12 months versus the S&P 500 for stocks listed on the U.S. and Canadian exchanges, versus the Bloomberg Europe Developed Markets Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (EDM) for stocks listed on the European exchanges and emerging markets exchanges outside of the Asia Pacific region, versus the Bloomberg Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index USD (JP) for stocks listed on the Japanese exchanges, and versus the Bloomberg Asia ex-Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (ASIAX) for stocks listed on the Asian (ex-Japan) exchanges - unless otherwise specified.
The Bernstein brand has three categories of ratings:

- Outperform: Stock will outpace the market index by more than 15 pp- Market-Perform: Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-15 pp- Underperform: Stock will trail the performance of the market index by more than 15 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.

The Autonomous brand rates stocks as indicated below. As our benchmarks we use the Bloomberg Europe 500 Banks And Financial Services Index (BEBANKS) and Bloomberg Europe Dev Mkt Financials Large and Mid Cap Price Ret Index EUR (EDMFI)index for developed European banks and Payments, the Bloomberg Europe 500 Insurance Index (BEINSUR) for European insurers, the S&P 500 and S&P Financials for US banks and Payments coverage, S5LIFE for US Insurance, the S&P Insurance Select Industry (SPSIINS) for US Non-Life Insurers coverage, and the Bloomberg Emerging Markets Financials Large, Mid and Small Cap Price Return Index (EMLSF) for emerging market banks and insurers and Payments. Ratings are stated relative to the sector (not the market).
The Autonomous brand has three categories of ratings:
·Outperform (OP): Stock will outpace the relevant index by more than 10 pp
·Neutral (N): Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-10 pp
·Underperform (UP): Stock will trail the performance of the relevant index by more than 10 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Those denoted as 'Feature' (e.g., Feature Outperform FOP, Feature Under Outperform FUP) are our core ideas. Not Covered (NC)denotes companies that are not under coverage.
For both brands, recommendations are based on a 12-month time horizon.
